definitions.definition: fastened securely in position.
examples: a fixed iron ladder down the port side
synonyms: anchored "there are fixed ropes on the rock face"

definitions.definition: (especially of a price, rate, or time) predetermined and not subject to or able to be changed.
examples: most trusts locked investors in for a fixed period

definitions.definition: (of a person's expression) held for a long time without changing, especially to conceal other feelings.
examples: a fixed smile

definitions.definition: (of a view or idea) held inflexibly.
examples: the fixed assumptions of the cold war

definitions.definition: situated with regard to.
examples: how's the club fixed for money now?

definitions.definition: (of a sports contest) having the outcome dishonestly predetermined.
examples: the fight's fixedâ€”the ref has your card marked

definitions.definition: fasten (something) securely in a particular place or position.
examples: fix the clamp on a rail
synonyms: clip "signs were fixed to utility poles"stick
branded "his words are fixed in my memory"

definitions.definition: lodge or implant (an idea, image, or memory) firmly in a person's mind.
examples: he turned back to fix the scene in his mind

definitions.definition: direct one's eyes, attention, or mind steadily or unwaveringly toward.
examples: I fixed my attention on the tower

definitions.definition: (of a person's eyes, attention, or mind) be directed steadily or unwaveringly toward.
examples: her gaze fixed on Jess
synonyms: train "his eyes were fixed on the ground"

definitions.definition: attract and hold (a person's attention or gaze).
examples: their taut relationship fixes your attention

definitions.definition: look at someone unwaveringly.
examples: she fixed her nephew with an unwavering stare

definitions.definition: mend; repair.
examples: you should fix that shelf

definitions.definition: do the necessary work to improve or adapt something.
examples: we want to fix up the house before we sell it

definitions.definition: make arrangements for (something); organize.
examples: he's sent her on ahead to fix things up
synonyms: furnish "we need to get Dolly fixed up with a job"

definitions.definition: restore order or tidiness to (something, especially one's hair, clothes, or makeup).
examples: Laura was fixing her hair
synonyms: brush; informaldo "Laura was fixing her hair"

definitions.definition: prepare or arrange for the provision of (food or drink).
examples: they were fixing him breakfast

definitions.definition: arrange for someone to have something; provide someone with something.
examples: I'll fix you up with a room
synonyms: furnish "we need to get Dolly fixed up with a job"

definitions.definition: arrange for someone to meet or go out with someone in order to help them establish a romantic relationship.
be intending or planning to do something.
examples: you're fixing to get into trouble

definitions.definition: decide or settle on (a specific price, date, course of action, etc.).
examples: no date has yet been fixed for a hearing
synonyms: specify "let's fix a date for the meeting"

definitions.definition: discover the exact location of (something) by using radar or visual bearings or astronomical observation.
examples: he fixed his position

definitions.definition: settle the form of (a language).
assign or determine (a person's liability or responsibility) for legal purposes.
examples: there are no facts that fix the defendant with liability

definitions.definition: make (something) permanent or static in nature.
examples: the rate of interest is fixed for the life of the loan

definitions.definition: make (a dye, photographic image, or drawing) permanent.
examples: make permanent, make fast, set chemicals are used to fix the dye

definitions.definition: preserve or stabilize (a specimen) with a chemical substance prior to microscopy or other examination.
examples: specimens were fixed in buffered formalin

definitions.definition: (of a plant or microorganism) assimilate (nitrogen or carbon dioxide) by forming a nongaseous compound.
examples: lupines fix gaseous nitrogen in their root nodules

definitions.definition: influence the outcome of (something, especially a race, contest, or election) by illegal or underhanded means.
examples: the foundation denies fixing races

definitions.definition: put (an enemy or rival) out of action, especially by killing them.
examples: don't you tell nobody, or I'll fix you good!
synonyms: deal with; sort someone out "don't tell anybody

definitions.definition: take an injection of a narcotic drug.
castrate or spay (an animal); neuter.
examples: castrate, neuter, geld, spay, desex, sterilize; Moreinformaldoctor, alter "the cat has been fixed"Moredoctor, alter the cat has been fixed
